Transcription: this tiny bedroom barely fits a bed leaving no space for a wardrobe or desk Oliver frustrated decides to tackle the problem himself first he builds a half wardrobe against the wall with a thick quilt on top and his frequently worn clothes hanging Below on the opposite side he sets up a half bookcase for his study materials he then connects a low cabinet in the Middle with two drawers for storage adds a cushion and turns it into a cozy sofa with a TV mounted on the wall Oliver can relax whenever he wants next he creates a floating desk by the window for his  a space and hangs curtains inside the window to saving space a small Blackboard nearby adds a practical touch for the bed he constructs a frame from galvanized square steel and covers it with eco-friendly wood veneer he adds a professional rib frame and a soft mattress borrowed from his aunt along with soft pads on the walls for a comfy sleep he carves out a thin hole on the side to serve as a bedside table above it he installs a swing cabinet for his favorite trinkets ads iron guard rails for safety and a ladder for easy access to top it off he puts in a  all ceiling fan to keep the room cool
